column4: My computer has slowed RIGHT the h3ll down. I have tried Janitor, and now my GNOME and GDM are crashy: Gnome will load a blank panel in 15 minutes, and GDM crashes to "desktop", i.e. Black. However, switching to a TTY and using the laptop (that needs repairs) as a thin-client for a desktop (that needs a separate monitor, I'm using a TV as it's screen LOL) it works using Xinit, Grandr and SSH. Nautilus works properly, but throws
an IO error when sending LARGE files across a USB adapter.
I will try Janitor again. I wil NOT use Gtkoprhan unless someone requests it. I need help!
Thank you Trill for telling us that your bad word was a slip.
HELLO!!!!! I do actually need help here.
have some patience
I've seen that when tar'ing files in corrupted filesystems, sparse files (such as virtual machine disks with space reserved) and pseudo filesystems as /proc
could you please explain your weirdness about FSCHK and the shrank file?
I was just sharing my experience. I've seen such messages when making (tar) backups of for example sparse files. Those are files with 'reserved' space
but I've also seen that when trying to backup a corrupted file, actually a file on a corrupted filesystem
I don't get it. Explain in a PM.
no thank you
is it indicative of a problem, on a server that has been running for yonks?
that *could* be, I'm just sharing what I've encountered. It also happens when performing tar backup of /sys and sometimes of already-tarrred-and-gzipped files.
and it happens to AVI's and BMP's.
see if you can restore the file(s) and if they're fine or not. That's really all I can give you right now
ok, enough. You've repeated your question (without giving any detail) several times. You know that such repeat is not acceptable.
and you know what you should do in that case, and the consequences if you don't
now everything's just being weird. Should I go the earmark, DVD, PC, DV Tape route? Or should I exclude those files?
I really don't see how such a general question (still without any detail) would be an ubuntu specific issue. I ask you now kindly to stop this discussion in this channel
It says the the file shrank. I will be taking overlay backups as a precaution.
you continue, I quiet you
